page.title: 17BEACON FELL COUNTRY PARK 1
page.content: Beacon Fell Country Park, owned and maintained by Lancashire County Council, is situated on a detached hillock on the fringe of the Forest of Bowland. At the summit of the fell (266m above sea level) is a trig and viewing point from which visitors can see the Forest of Bowland to the north, the Fylde plain and Blackpool to the west and Preston and the Pennine moors to the south. The upper slopes of the fell are covered in predominantly coniferous woodland and are criss-crossed by footpaths. Throughout the year, large numbers of tourists _ motorists and walkers (from the very young to the old) - are attracted to the park which is supervised by a full_time country warden and volunteers.
